structure.unit: Registration Of Certain Professions And Occupations

law.catch_line: Reissuance Of Certificate After Revocation; Duplicate Certificates; Fee
law.text: The board, for any reason which it may deem sufficient, may reissue a certificate of registration to any person whose certificate has been revoked, if three or more members of the board vote in favor of such reissuance. A new certificate of registration, to replace any certificate revoked, lost, destroyed or mutilated, may be issued, subject to the rules of the board, and a charge to be determined annually by the commissioner of administration under the provision of section three B of chapter seven shall be made for such issuance.
